contextId.information: The word "himself" is used to emphasize that he was alone. AT: "he walked by himself for a day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
contextId.quote: he himself went a day's journey

contextId.information: The word "himself" indicates that Elisha was plowing with the last yoke, while other men were plowing with the other eleven yokes. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he himself was plowing with the twelfth yoke
